db:abstract.db:para: The geocircle type represents a circular geographic area.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The geocircle type is a geoshape that represents a circular geographic area. It is a direct representation of a QGeoCircle and is defined in terms of a coordinate which specifies the center of the circle and a qreal which specifies the radius of the circle in meters.
The circle is considered invalid if the center coordinate is invalid or if the radius is less than zero.

db:section.db:title: Example Usage

When integrating with C++, note that any QGeoCircle value passed into QML from C++ is automatically converted into a geocircle value, and vise-versa.

db:section.db:title: center
db:section.db:para: This property holds the coordinate of the center of the geocircle.

db:section.db:title: radius
db:section.db:para: This property holds the radius of the geocircle in meters.
The default value for the radius is -1 indicating an invalid geocircle area.
